intro: Meconopsis lyrata, commonly known as the Himalayan blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet petals and its ability to thrive in high-altitude environments. The plant has palmate leaves that are usually hairy and adapted to cold climates. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species. Meconopsis lyrata is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
